victim.ante:
This is dashcam footage. Focus ONLY on the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (the "ANTE" period - before any collision).

Draft a narrative description of the surrounding context:
- Environment: Describe road conditions, weather, visibility, and traffic density.
- POV vehicle behavior: Describe how the POV vehicle (the source of the dashcam) is moving and interacting with the environment.
- Traffic situation: Identify other vehicles nearby and their relative positions.
- Narrative: Combine these into a cohesive story of the moments leading up to the incident.

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe other vehicles by color/type (e.g., "red sedan").
victim.event:
This is dashcam footage. Focus ONLY on the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (the "EVENT" period - the collision/incident).

Draft a detailed narrative of the incident and assign fault:
- Narrative: Describe the exact sequence of events during the collision. How did it happen?
- Vehicles involved: Identify all parties. Refer to the dashcam source ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe others by appearance.
- Dynamics: Point of impact and immediate vehicle responses.
- Fault Assignment: Based on the visual evidence, provide a reasoned assignment of fault. Explain why a specific vehicle (POV vehicle or another) is responsible based on observed behavior or traffic rules.

Be detailed and objective. This is the MOST IMPORTANT section capturing the actual incident.
victim.post:
This is dashcam footage. Focus ONLY on the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (the "POST" period - after the collision).

Draft a narrative description of the aftermath:
- Scene Status: Vehicle positions after impact and any secondary hazards created.
- POV vehicle response: Actions taken by the POV vehicle immediately following the crash.
- Final state: Final resting positions of all involved parties and the environment.

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe other vehicles by appearance.

offender.ante:
This is dashcam footage. Focus ONLY on the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (the "ANTE" period).

Draft a narrative description of the POV vehicle's approach:
- POV vehicle actions: Describe speed, lane changes, or any aggressive maneuvers taken by the POV vehicle.
- Environment: Road conditions and traffic flow from the POV vehicle's perspective.
- Hazards: Any obstacles the POV vehicle may have missed or misjudged.
- Narrative: Combine these into a story explaining the POV vehicle's path leading to the incident.

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe other vehicles by appearance.
offender.event:
This is dashcam footage. Focus ONLY on the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (the "EVENT" period).

Draft a narrative of the impact caused by the POV vehicle:
- Collision Narrative: Describe how the POV vehicle initiated or failed to avoid the collision.
- Point of Impact: Where the POV vehicle struck the other party.
- Evasive Actions: Any last-second (or lack thereof) attempts by the POV vehicle to brake or swerve.
- Fault Analysis: Objectively describe how the POV vehicle's actions led to the fault assignment.

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe others by appearance.
offender.post:
This is dashcam footage. Focus ONLY on the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (the "POST" period).

Draft a narrative of the POV vehicle's immediate response to the fault:
- Stopping: How quickly the POV vehicle came to a halt.
- Damage: Visual assessment of the damage caused by the POV vehicle to others and itself.
- Final Scene: The final resting position of the POV vehicle relative to the victims.

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe others by appearance.

witness.ante:
This is dashcam footage where the POV vehicle is a bystander. Focus ONLY on the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (the "ANTE" period).

Draft a narrative of the observed environment:
- Observed Vehicles: Identify the vehicles ahead or around the POV vehicle that will later collide.
- Their Behavior: Describe any erratic or noteworthy driving by those vehicles before the crash.
- POV Status: The POV vehicle's role as a passive observer in traffic.

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle". Describe the third-party vehicles by appearance.
witness.event:
This is dashcam footage where the POV vehicle is a bystander. Focus ONLY on the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (the "EVENT" period).

Draft a narrative of the collision between other parties:
- Incident Narrative: Describe the collision between the third-party vehicles as seen from the POV vehicle.
- POV Safety: Note that the POV vehicle was NOT involved in the impact.
- Dynamics: How the colliding vehicles moved and interacted with each other.
- Fault Assignment: Assign fault between the third-party vehicles involved in the crash.

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle".
witness.post:
This is dashcam footage where the POV vehicle is a bystander. Focus ONLY on the time range from {{start}}s to {{end}}s (the "POST" period).

Draft a narrative of the witness response:
- POV Actions: Does the POV vehicle pull over to help or capture the scene?
- Scene Status: The positions of the colliding vehicles after they have come to rest.
- Secondary Hazards: Any risks to other traffic (including the POV vehicle) created by the crash.

Refer to the dashcam vehicle ONLY as "POV vehicle".
